Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder of a red-brown pottery jar, the fabric is grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, with base of one handle surviving, is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394159) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394159)
